description: field describing aspect of the investigation/study to which the sample belongs
basic fields
Example "m"
field describing environmental aspect of a sample
A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI
notes: abstracted pattern: prefix:typecode-authshoulder-blade(.version)?(_seqsuffix)?|a minimum length of 3 characters is suggested for typecodes, but 1 or 2 characters will be accepted|typecodes must correspond 1:1 to a class in the NMDC schema. this will be checked via per-class id slot usage assertions|minting authority shoulders should probably be enumerated and checked in the pattern

description: A human readable label for an entity
a human-readable description of a thing

deprecated: Due to confusion about what values are used for this slot, it is best not to use this slot. See https://github.com/microbiomedata/nmdc-schema/issues/248. MAM removed designates_type and rdf:type slot uri 2022-11-30
description: An optional string that specifies the type object.  This is used to allow for searches for different kinds of objects.

A name given to the entity that differs from the name/label programmatically assigned to it. For example, when extracting study information for GOLD, the GOLD system has assigned a name/label. However, for display purposes, we may also wish the capture the title of the proposal that was used to fund the study.
A list of alternative titles for the entity. The distinction between title and alternative titles is application-specific.
A list of alternative names used to refer to the entity. The distinction between name and alternative names is application-specific.
A list of alternative descriptions for the entity. The distinction between description and alternative descriptions is application-specific.
A list of alternative identifiers for the entity.

todos: this slot needs some basic textual annotations and constraints
this slot needs some basic textual annotations and constraints

description: Should use ISO 639-1 code e.g. "en", "fr"
A attribute of a biosample. Examples: depth, habitat, material. For NMDC, attributes SHOULD be mapped to terms within a MIxS template
The value that was specified for an annotation in raw form, i.e. a string. E.g. "2 cm" or "2-4 cm"
Links a QuantityValue to a unit
Links a quantity value to a number
The minimum value part, expressed as number, of the quantity value when the value covers a range.
The maximum value part, expressed as number, of the quantity value when the value covers a range.
Links a quantity value to a boolean
latitude
longitude
pointer to an ontology class
The ORCID of a person.
An email address for an entity such as a person. This should be the primary email address used.
One or more other email addresses for an entity.
A url that points to an image of a person.
An input to a process.
An output biosample to a processing step
Links a resource to another resource that either logically or physically includes it.
Example: NERSC-Cori

notes: See issue 207 - this clashes with the mixs field

description: When rendering information, this attribute to specify the order in which the information should be rendered.
Example: https://github.com/microbiomedata/mg_annotation/releases/tag/0.1
Size of the file in bytes
MD5 checksum of file (pre-compressed)
The abstract of manuscript/grant associated with the entity; i.e., a summary of the resource.
A list of keywords that used to associate the entity. Keywords SHOULD come from controlled vocabularies, including MESH, ENVO.
The scientific objectives associated with the entity. It SHOULD correspond to scientific norms for objectives field in a structured abstract.
A list of websites that are associated with the entity.
A list of publications that are associated with the entity. The publications SHOULD be given using an identifier, such as a DOI or Pubmed ID, if possible.

notes: key set to false due to rare collisions: Pletnev I, Erin A, McNaught A, Blinov K, Tchekhovskoi D, Heller S (2012) InChIKey collision resistance: an experimental testing. J Cheminform. 4:12
